RoleResponsibility: About the Institute for Infocomm Research (IÂ_R) The Institute for Infocomm Research (IÂ_R) is a member of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) family and is Singaporeâ€™s largest ICT research institute. Our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. For more information about I2R, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg We are looking for strong candidates in the field of Artificial Intelligence and deep learning, with an interest in working on both fundamental algorithms in large-scale machine learning or deep learning, and also applying it to practical problems in vertical domains. The position, based within the Program in Artificial Intelligence at I2R, entails working closely with a highly interdisciplinary team of researchers with training from leading universities at MIT, Stanford and CMU. Listed below are problems of interest in the Deep Leaming 2.0 project: Deep learning application in AME (Semiconductor domain): Explore state-of-the-art deep learning technologies in Advance Manufacturing Engineering, especially in semiconductor industries. Including, but not limited to, yield analysis and prediction, predictive maintenance (PdM), advanced DoE analysis and prediction, etc. Medical Imaging Analysis: Combined with traditional medical imaging method, explore deep learning methods, such as segmentation, multiphase classification, etc., to improve the performance of disease detection, prediction, and treatment based on CT, X-Ray, etc. Multi-Target Deep Learning: Different branches or targets in a neutral network can enhance each other's performance. Compared with end-to-end deep neutral network, multi-target deep learn can handle multiple targets simultaneously and in this way, the speed, efficiency, and performance can be improved. Multimodal Deep Learning: Towards effective learning from heterogeneous data sources Currently, deep learning is applied in various areas such as visual computing, speech recognition, text mining, etc. In each area, the learning model is trained with large amounts of data in isolation. A multimodal learning approach from heterogeneous data sources, including video, speech, text, etc. is necessary to achieve breakthrough in performance. Incorporating Knowledge Graphs into Deep Learning: Towards better understanding of images Current deep learning systems today have no real understanding of images, with output typically a bunch of bounding boxes, learnt using a large number of label or sentence-level associations. Knowledge graphs like the MIT ConceptNet will be used to understand higher-level semantics and relationships between entities, to improve classification accuracy
Requirements: PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science intensive fields with expertise in one or more of the following areas:    Large-scale machine learning Deep learning, supervised or unsupervised Applying state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to practical problems in different domains   Experience in corporate or application oriented environments Experience with Tensor Flow, Theano, Caffe, CNTK skills Strong programming skills in Perl, Bash, C/C++, Java, Python, R, MATLAB Possess computer vision and deep learning skills Ability to work independently Team player Good interpersonal and communication skills  The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

the Respiratory Effectiveness Group There are also opportunities to design prospective, interventional, randomised controlled clinical trials in collaboration with the clinical research and operational team in OPC Global

RoleResponsibility: Nugit is on a mission to help marketers make smarter decisions. We believe decisions based on data are better. Do you want to be part of a team of account managers to deliver a best-in-class customer experience? Would you like to equip clients with data analysis skills to help their businesses grow faster and better? Do you enjoy building strong client relationships with some of the biggest media and technology firms in the region? Company: S&P GLOBAL ASIAN HOLDINGS PTE. LTD.
RoleResponsibility: The Role: Asia Head of Analytics The Location: Singapore The Team:Â S&P Global Platts provides analytics across all commodities to provide an integrated view of global markets to deliver valuable insights to our customers. Asia is a significant growing market for which we intend to grow our presence and quality of analytics.Â Â  Understanding the supply and demand dynamics across all commodities in every region and how the market will respond to tensions is one of the capabilities that sets S&P Global Platts apart from our competitors.Â  The Head of Analytics in Asia will be responsible for coordinating this analysis in the region while ensuring that it is integrated into the global view across each of the commodities.Â  The Impact: The Asia Head of Analytics will be responsible for all analysis related to short term trends in global commodities across Asia, Oceania and the Middle East.Â  They will be expected to build relationships with key stakeholders and customers in the region in order to grow revenue for the business and grow our sources of data and market information.Â Â  The individual will be expected to develop a detailed understanding of Supply and Demand in the region along with changes in assets and stocks.Â  We aim to provide dynamic real time analysis of the market by tracking changes in supply, demand, stocks and movements leveraging some of our proprietary tools such as cFlow trade analytics and our World Refinery Database.Â Â  By sourcing the best data we look to build comprehensive models in order to understand changes in prices and margins.Â  To be successful the candidate must have a strong understanding of modelling as well as the relationship between commodities such as Oil, Chemicals, Biofuels, LNG, Coal and renewables to create one integrated Platts view of energy demand to help our customers Whatâ€™s in it for you:  You will be a key member of the Platts Analytics Leadership Team You will run a team of up to 12 analysts based in locations across Asia including Singapore and Mainland China (who will have dotted lines to respective commodity lines). You will represent the S&P Global Platts Analytics view to customers, other market participants such as governments and the media (working closely with our news teams) within Asia. You will be expected to present at external conferences to promote our analysis and build the Platts Analytics brand You will be responsible to this integral piece of work with the objective of growing the business and revenue from Analytics in the region.  Responsibilities:  The role will cover all countries East of Suez including the Middle East, South and East Asia and Oceana. Commodities include Oil, Gas/LNG, Chemicals, Coal, Power (incl. renewables), Biofuels/Agriculture and Metals. Collaborating with the Global Heads of Oil Demand, Oil Production, Refinery Margins & Tradeflow, NGL & Chemicals, Gas and Power, Policy and Scenarios. Contribute to supply and demand modeling for Asia (working closely with the Heads of Oil Demand, and Gas and Power), identifying sources of data to support short-term forecasts as well as understanding emerging trends (e.g. EVs, Gas for Transport) to support of the Scenario Planning Service long-term forecasts. Develop tools to determine the demand for feedstocks to support the total energy need of the region understanding the pricing switching points between energy sources and feedstocks including utilities fuel switching.Collaborate with other commodity heads to understand local production trends and trade flow of feedstocks across the region including Crude, NGLs, LNG Coal, and Chemicals.Â  Integrate the non-refinery supply view into the balance around call on refining understanding the dynamics of trends in refinery throughput such as crude import quotas into China. Contribute to data input to the PIRA World Refinery Database, producing accurate, timely capacity, outage and run data for every refinery in the region and helping to enhance it to better predict likely unplanned events and their impact on margin and product supply. Deliver regular spotlights and reports for the region and present analysis to customers and at events. Interact with customers to answer questions and deliver outlooks.
Requirements: What Weâ€™re Looking For:   Minimum 15 years of relevant work experience (energy industry, consulting, investment banking, equity research or equivalent professional experience) Demonstrate successful leadership of diverse and virtual teams. MA/MS or PHD desired preferably in economics, statistics, engineering, operations research or a similar field with exposure to applied quantitative analysis and forecasting in the energy industry. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Experience and familiarity with the energy industry and markets required, in particular oil demand, refining and power markets. Fluency in statistical and economic modeling techniques and knowledge of advanced quantitative tools and programming languages are preferred. Excellent attention to detail. Successful candidates will possess a strong entrepreneurial spirit, are highly self-directed and motivated, and work well under tight deadlines.  Kindly formally apply for the role online at our Careers Website at https://www.spglobal.com/careers where you can also learn more about our company and the benefits of working at S&P Global. S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or other legally protected categories, subject to applicable law.

Company: BERKELEY EDUCATION ALLIANCE FOR RESEARCH IN SINGAPORE LIMITED
RoleResponsibility: This Postdoctoral Scholar position will have a focus on the analysis of collections of non-residential buildings.Â  These City-Scale Analytics will focus on the transformation of data from hundreds or even thousands of non-residential buildings.Â  Sub-hourly meter, sub-meter and sensor data from large groups of buildings will be transformed according to various methods of temporal feature extraction techniques to create a library of time-series data characterizations from buildings.Â  These features can be combined with various building meta-data such as construction, form, surrounding environment, design elements, materials, etc. to create a more detailed snapshot of a building's personality.Â  This characterization can be used to better benchmark buildings to find candidates for performance improvements and understand better why a building performs well or not.Â  The output of this work will better inform policy-markers regarding the actual current state of the building stock, assist designers in understanding which energy savings features actually work in reality, and energy analysts in targeting poor performers. This research will be undertaken with SinBerBEST 2 (SBB 2) under the direction of Dr Kameshwar Poolla (UCB) and Dr Clayton Miller (NUS).Â  The project will be within Theme D: Data Analytics of SinBerBEST 2 (SBB 2).Â  The expected output of this position is at least two conference proceedings or journal publications per year.
Requirements: The Postdoctoral Scholar is expected to hold a PhD degree in Computer Science and Electrical Engineering or equivalent. An interested candidate needs to send us a detailed CV including a list of publications, a description about past relevant experiences and achievements that are relevant to the above advertised post, and the contact information of at least two references.

RoleResponsibility: The successful applicant for this position will be joining the Analytical Development team within Clinical Development in Lonza Singapore, focusing on test method validation, development and life cycle management. The Clinical Development group is responsible for the development and characterization of manufacturing processes used for the production of novel therapeutic recombinant proteins for Lonzaâ€™s global client base. Test methods include, but are not limited to, techniques using capillary electrophoresis, HPLC, spectrophotometry, ELISAs, etc. Maintenance of test method life cycles, analytical equipment, and related technologies and/or systems. Experience working within a formal Quality Management System (such as cGMP)  General  To work to the highest scientific standards under the direction of the Line Manager. Lead improvements in scientific practice and identify error traps within the laboratory and within processes to improve standards. The role may require occasional weekend work. Well organised with good problem solving skills, a high level of attention to detail and have a passion for delivering high quality data on time. Execution multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring work is planned and scheduled appropriately and delivered to agreed timelines and quality standards.

JobTitle: Assistant Executive / Senior Assistant Executive (Talent Management), PSC Sect
RoleResponsibility: The Public Service Commission (PSC) was constituted in 1951 as an independent organ of state to appoint, promote, transfer, dismiss and exercise disciplinary control over public officers. The PSC Secretariat provides secretariat support to the PSC. This includes formulating conduct and discipline policies, to ensure that officers maintain the highest standards of personal conduct and integrity.Â  One significant non-statutory role of the PSC is the award of PSC scholarships for undergraduate and postgraduate studies. The Secretariat assists in the formulation of scholarship policies, talent recruitment and development of PSC scholarship holders as potential future leaders in the Public Service. Reporting to the Senior Manager (Talent Management), you will be part of the team to support and facilitate the Public Service Commissionâ€™s work in securing and developing top-tier talent through PSC scholarships and maintaining oversight on scholarships throughout the public service. Responsibilities  Support to manage the scholarships system for receiving PSC and ministry scholarship applications and maintenance of scholarship holdersâ€™ records and progress monitoring. Assist with the operations of system maintenance, generation and compilation of data for research purposes, assess change requests from users and liaise with technical experts to improve processes. Support the administration of PSC scholarships, including liaising with applicants/candidates and partnering agencies involved in the scholarship selection,Â and preparation of documents for scholarship interviews. Assist in the planning and execution of scholarship events and development programmes for scholarship holders. Organise and co-ordinate networking and engagement events with local and overseas educational institutions/universities, pre-university students and their parents, including scholarship information sessions, internships and learning journeys, to ensure the alignment of the value proposition of Public Service careers with public perception. Manage enquires on Talent Management matters from the public and other government agencies which are received through the PSC email account and hotline enquiries. Maintain up-to-date log on all enquires for knowledge management.  Requirements [Values]  We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service. [Work Experience & Competencies]   Recognised Polytechnic Diploma. Good level of proficiency in MS Excel is required (intermediate level).  Competent in dealing with data analytics and information system.  Proficiency in data visualisation tools such as Tableau and programme development languages such as HTML, SQL or VBA will be preferred.   [Personal Traits]   Strong interest in organising and analysing large volume of data.  Good interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills. Excellent team player who is able to thrive in a fast-paced environment.   Shortlisted candidates will be notified within 2 weeks after the closing date. Successful candidates will be offered a 2-year contract in the first instance.

JobTitle: Senior Principal Investigator  /  Principal Investigator (SICS)  /  A*STAR
RoleResponsibility: About Singapore Institute for Clinical Sciences (SICS) Â  Established in 2007, the Singapore Institute for Clinical Sciences (SICS) is a research institute within the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR), and its mission is to develop clinical and translational research programmes in key disease areas. Â  SICS is distinguished by its focus on clinical sciences and the use of innovative approaches and technologies that enable the efficient and effective study of human health and diseases. The clinical scientists in SICS conduct the full spectrum of â€œbench to bedsideâ€ù research activities in metabolic diseases (including diabetes, obesity and insulin resistance), pathways to normal growth and development (including cognitive and behavioural development), and nutritional sciences. The institute aims to attract, train and nurture clinician-scientists and to develop joint programmes with universities, academic medical centres, government hospitals and research institutes. Â  For more information about A*STAR and SICS, please visit www.a-star.edu.sg and www.sics.a-star.edu.sg respectively. Â  Job Summary: The systems biology group at the Singapore Institute for Clinical Sciences (SICS) invites applications for Principal Investigator position in the area of Bioinformatics and Artificial Intelligence. Â  Job Responsibilities: The successful candidate will  Join an active group of biostatisticians, analysts, and programmers working on data from metabolic, neurodevelopment and nutrition platforms. Develop machine learning and AI methods to study cutting-edge research questions related to genomic and phenotypic variation in our cohorts. Collaborate with experimental groups, clinicians and industry. Integrate internal and external omics data with phenome for comprehensive analysis Write scientific manuscripts and data reports. Establish impactful and creative research.
Requirements: PhD and at least 5 years of relevant experience either in academia or industry, in computational biology, bioinformatics, or relevant field (e.g., bioinformatics, big data analysis). Strong analytical skills and a notable publication record. The candidate must be comfortable working in a dynamic research organization and able to balance multiple responsibilities. Strong communication skills and a willingness to work collaboratively in a multidisciplinary environment. Grounding in machine learning theory and recent advances in deep learning Excellent algorithm development and programming experience (e.g. C/C++, R, S-plus, SQL, Java, and Oracle) Proven record of knowledge in the area of analytical methods for observational clinical outcomes data  Â  The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. RoleResponsibility: Omnicom Media Group (OMG) is the media services and communications division of Omnicom Group Inc. (NYSE: OMC), the leading global advertising, marketing and corporate communications company, providing services to over 5,000 clients in more than 100 countries. A forward-thinking media and communications company, Omnicom Media Group includes two key full service, award winning agency brands, PHD and OMD, plus a suite of specialist media communication units. In the Asia Pacific region, Omnicom Media Group has 47 offices in 18 countries with over 4,000 staff members.Â  Over the last 5 years, no other media agency network has been awarded more Agency of The Year awards than Omnicom Media Group and its brands. Driven by a culture of innovation, collaboration, integrity, entrepreneurship and dynamism, Omnicom Media Groupâ€™s mission is to "challenge mediocrity" in a commoditised world where most media agencies are the same. This is about having a culture of creativity and constantly delivering innovation, thought leadership and ground-breaking ideas. This is about providing future-facing, industry-leading capabilities and technologies.Â  Most importantly, it's about having the best and most experienced talent in the business. POSITION PURPOSE Head of Performance Development is responsible for developing OMGâ€™s Programmatic and Performance capabilities. This includes go-to-market offering across screens and formats including video, display, mobile, connected TV, paid-Social, paid-Search, etc.Â  This is inclusive of developing platform strategy, inventory practices and improving capabilities across activation teams. This role will demand you build key relationships with our DSP, Paid-Search and Paid-Social suppliers, as well as inventory partners and data suppliers, with the goal of improving our product offering.Â  You will be constantly evaluating capability gaps and new partners in the market to determine strategies for growing value and delivery to clients. The candidate will be a key driver in increasing profitability and penetration of existing and new capabilities based on market evolution and customer demands.Â  This role will not only entail managing platform solutions, but having a strong working knowledge of their feature sets to drive the overall planning, delivery, and technical integrations to determine optimal solutions for our clients.Â  STRUCTURE This position reports to the CEO Performance APAC and works in close partnership with the local market Programmatic and Performance leads to develop and implement the proposition. This role will also work closely with regional and local Investment and Annalect teams. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES  Lead platforms & capability roadmap factoring in technology, data, inventory and measurement propositions. Drive the roadmap and growth plans for OMGâ€™s overall platform strategy, developing key technology partnerships, resource plans, budgets and go-to-market plans to achieve it. Drive improvements in practices across key focus areas including video, mobile, measurement and data propositions across the Programmatic and Performance teams. Seek and evaluate new partnerships to deliver on the roadmap. Build strong relationships with OMG strategic partners (publishers, technology and data partners) to ensure strong support and partnership value. Evaluate and test new and evolving technologies in the market to ensure Performance teams have the best work product to meet client demands. Work with local markets to build out new testing projects with various betas and proof-of-concepts and to then package the learnings into case studies and use cases. Anticipate gaps in offering and drive innovation in new areas of Programmatic and Performance. Advocate and educate clients, internal groups, OMG leadership, Annalect teams, etc. on capabilities and platform roadmaps. Support OMG Leadership team on projects related to overall business development. Support in APAC business development pipeline for new clients and expanding remit on existing clients and new business pitch support.
Requirements: SPECIFIC FOCUS AREAS: PLATFORMS & PARTNERSHIPS   Develop partnerships and platform roadmap based on new capabilities in market, or changing client needs. Includes scouting based on specific needs (e.g. DOOH, Audio etc), evaluations, testing plans. Lead DSP and Performance technology partnerships with input from Programmatic and Performance leads. This includes engagement plans across teams, ensuring prioritised beta access, collaborative feature development, etc. Working with Annalect to identify gaps in data vendors relevant to our client set and seek partnerships to fulfil needs (e.g. commerce/retail, auto). Transform business requirements and opportunities into product requests that can be briefed to tech platforms to address/build.  INNOVATION & CAPABILITY DEVELOPMENT   Ensure Performance capabilities are developing in areas such as measurement, format adoption, mobile capabilities. Develop go-to-market documentation as required, to ensure adoption and development of best practices. Lead knowledge program across teams in areas pertinent to industry development e.g. ads.txt, ITP, iOS cookie changes, etc. With the help of local market input, develop POV documents around key areas of industry development. Develop the Performance story. Create polished, compelling stories that reveal how data and technology can help marketers be smarter and nimbler. Work with OMG leadership team to identify and lead projects in areas for innovation to deliver on client needs in the ever-changing media landscape (e.g. Machine Learning/AI, cross-channel solutions, blockchain, etc.)  INVENTORY   Working with the regional Investment teams to help build out preferred trading approaches, deal management. Work with local teams to implement the optimal approach to deliver on these deals. Develop infrastructure and processes for inventory analytics to identify areas for efficiency improvements or closer publisher partnerships. Lead qualitative improvements in inventory approach from a fraud, viewability and safety perspective.  OPERATIONAL INNOVATION & GROWTH  Work with OMG Performance CEO to expand efficiency of regional operations year over year, including knowledge management/ training, client adoption tracking, and administration support to finance and compliance teams on legal and audit requirements. Builds and hones deep and trusting relationships with internal account and functional leads to ensure we provide the required support and solutions for account teams and ensuring quality of deliverables to clients. Models and coaches internal teams on how to effectively position products, services and capabilities to our clients.  KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE  Qualified individuals possess the values of being fearlessly innovative, curious, marketing centric, putting our people first, and collaborative. 10+ years of relevant experience with progressive levels of responsibility in a consumer-focused Performance Agency, Trading Desk, or Ad Tech company that leveraged DSP or platform technologies. Exceptional understanding of AdTech and digital technologies including DSPâ€™s, Ad Servers, Self-serve platforms, tagging, etc. People management experiences in matrixed and remote team environments. Strong knowledge of project management techniques including process mapping, performance documentation, reporting and analytical methodologies, techniques, and tools necessary. Exceptional communicator and presenter in small and large group environments.

Check completion of each pathology case before forms/reports are filed. Disposal of outdated documents. Fresh secretarialÂ are acceptable. Previous experience in office or healthcare setting would be an advantage. Teamwork and interpersonal relationship skills are important.  Competencies / Skillsets Competency & Definition 1 Technical Competency - Proficiency in medical report transcription. 2 Computer Skill -Â Competent in using medical and office systems. 3 Customer Service -Â Meet requirements of internal and external customers. 4Â Secretarial Skill -Â Satisfactory secretarial support for pathologists and Pathology Office / Department. RoleResponsibility: About Essence Essence, part of GroupM, is a data-driven global agency that blends data science, objective media and captivating experiences to build valuable connections between brands and consumers. Clients include Google, FrieslandCampina, and the Financial Times. The agency is more than 1,100 people strong, manages over $3B in media spend and deploys campaigns in 71 markets via its global offices throughout North America, EMEA and APAC.  Visit essenceglobal.com for more information and follow us on Twitter at @essenceglobalâ€‹.â€‹ Â  About the role The Strategy group at Essence is focused on moving the discipline forward into a new era of insights and business solutions. Some of the things weâ€™d like you to do: Weâ€™d like you to be a trusted resource and partner to our clients, especially their strategy and innovation leads, not afraid to have the tough conversations when necessary, but also willing to adapt to their needs. You should enjoy working at the edge of what is known in our industry and fueled by trying to figure it out. Some days you will be presenting your ideas to clients, and some days you will be providing others with ideas to present. You will feel supported and support others in return. Â
Requirements: A bit about yourself:   At least 8 years of relevant experience (strategy, consulting, research, insight)   Prior experience working on a global brand and presenting strategies to senior stakeholders   Strong understanding of Â media planning (possible past life). Offline understanding a plus.Â    Strong understanding of the SEA market - media, audiences and culture.   Working knowledge of market and audience research tools   Understanding of Facebook, Google, Twitter, Snapchat, LinkedIn etc and how we can use data from these platforms for insights.Â    Vision for where communications strategy and the wider marketing industry is going   More analytical than creative, yet strong in both.   An MBA is a plus   Experience at business consultancies is a plus    What you can expect from Essence Essenceâ€™s mission is to make advertising more valuable to the world. Â We do this by employing the worldâ€™s very best talent to solve some of the toughest challenges of todayâ€™s digital marketing landscape. Â Itâ€™s important that we hire people whose values reflect those of our own: genuine, results-focused, daring and insightful. As an Essence employee, we promise you a workplace that invests in your career, cares for you and is fun and engaging. Â We believe these factors create a workplace where you can be yourself and do amazing work.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, or marital status.

JobTitle: Strategy and Insights Analyst, Agency Business Development - Singapore
RoleResponsibility: Company overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we donâ€™t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the worldâ€™s most successful organizations â€“ a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind â€“ but even as we continue to grow, weâ€™re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Global Agency & Global Accounts (GAGA) The Global Agency & Global Accounts (GAGA) group is the link between Google and its top global agency and client partners. GAGA teams help identify, develop and shape global client and agency engagement across a full suite of media, technology and platform products. Our goal is to accelerate client success and help our partners transform their businesses through product adoption, digital capability development, joint business planning and country benchmarking. The role: Strategy and Insights Analyst, Agency Business Development - Singapore Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. As a Strategy and Insights Analyst, you'll be transforming and advancing the Agency ecosystem in APAC with Google as a key enabler. You'll work to get underneath growth metrics, challenging our agency partners and the broader media industry to help inform our Go-to-Market solutions in the areas of performance, content, measurement and Cloud.Â   Youâ€™ll team up with regional and local agency business leaders and Product Specialists to dissect business challenges end-to-end, from product through to finance, growth, retention, operations and acquisition. Youâ€™ll provide quantitative support, business understanding and a strategic perspective to the APAC organization while representing the agency business. You will serve as an analytics expert for our agency business leaders, using numbers to help them make sound business decisions. Responsibilities:  Provide quantitative support and serve as a data analytics expert for Googleâ€™s agency business leaders. Develop comprehensive understanding of Google data structures, sources and metrics. Work with large, complex data sets. Solve difficult, non-routine analytical problems, applying rigorous analytical methods as needed. Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, processing, analysis, synthesizing and presentations to multiple stakeholders.
Requirements: Minimum qualifications:  6 years of work experience in financial/quantitative analysis or consulting. Experience working with quantitative financial modeling and reporting.  Preferred qualifications:  Experience working with SQL and statistical coding (e.g. R, C/C++, Python, SAS, Matlab, etc). Experience working on A/B experiments. Experience in management consulting, corporate strategy, product planning and market research. Demonstrated bias towards action and detail; able to self-direct work in an unstructured environment. Highly self-directed, an effective individual contributor and a team player. Effective partnership and collaboration skills with cross-functional teams. Distinctive problem solving and analysis skills, combined with excellent business judgment and leadership. Ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders.

JobTitle: Anti Financial Crime â€“ Anti Money Laundering Monitoring Officer - Analyst
RoleResponsibility: Regulation, Compliance & Anti-Financial Crime Regulation, Compliance and Anti-Financial Crime (AFC) protects the integrity and reputation of Deutsche Bank. It manages the Bankâ€™s risks and help to avert unintentional rule breaches and conflicts of interest. At the same time, we also advise the bank on ethical conduct and governance issues and keep the bank up to date on regulatory and political challenges. Overview Business Overview The Asia-Pacific Anti-Financial Crime Department supports Deutsche Bank businesses in the region manage AFC risk, is responsible for ensuring that related processes are in place and that all policies, procedures and guidelines conform to internal Deutsche Bank policies as well as all applicable laws and regulations. The AML Monitoring Officerâ€™s primary responsibility will be alert and case handling and conducting investigations, while assisting with other FCI-related duties inclusive processes such as User Acceptance and Quality Assurance testing. Â The AML Monitoring Officer is expected to be equipped with product knowledge and bring expertise in investigative processes and effective alert and case- handling procedures. Position Overview The Financial Crime Investigations (FCI) Officer will be located in Singapore and report to FCI Manager, or delegated manager for Wealth Management.Â  Depending on the experience of the candidate, some or all of the following responsibilities will be assigned:  Perform AML monitoring of assigned businesses or jurisdictions. Perform or support autonomous reviews and investigations. Coordinate and/or prepare the required management information reporting data for local, regional or global submission as applicable. Participate in FCI-related technical and project work and user-acceptance tests. Provide input on key initiatives and other ad hoc projects as needed. Review and investigate system-generated alerts and ad-hoc cases within the mandated timeframe. Review and analyse daily AML/CTF cases to address transactions that contravene the banks/regulatory policies. Ensure that review and investigation conclusions are adequately and properly documented for regulatory/audit level review. Conduct internet and external database searches to ensure no adverse information (RAI) is noted on the client/parties. Ensure the risk coverage for the bank from an AML/CTF perspective. RoleResponsibility: About the Institute of High Performance ComputingÂ (IHPC) A*STARâ€™s Institute of High Performance Computing (IHPC) was established in April 1998 to provide leadership in high performance computing as a strategic resource for scientific inquiry and industry development. It seeks to power discoveries through advanced methodologies, techniques and new tools in modelling, simulation and visualisation. Its core research areas are in the realm of complex-coupled systems, mechanics and fluid dynamics, large-scale systems, digital modelling, adaptive and collaborative computing, data mining and analysis, computational electronics and electromagnetics, computational materials science and chemistry.Â  For more information about IHPC, please visit www.ihpc.a-star.edu.sgÂ  Job Description You will conduct research on laminar-turbulent transition under favorable pressure gradient conditions. The project aims to improve our understanding on how the geometry of the surface imperfection affects the transition location, as well as how it affects the underlying physical mechanisms that results in the breakdown to turbulence. In this role, youÂ will work closely with scientists from IHPC, as well as with collaborators from local university. They will be tasked with performing Direct Numerical Simulations (DNS) of boundary-layer transition, which will be validated with both literature data, and data from wind tunnel experiments. You areÂ expected to work with the team in improving DNS capabilities for modelling of transition, write papers, and communicate with partners regularly.
Requirements: PhD in Mechanical Engineering/Physics or equivalent Possess good understanding on turbulent flows, laminar to turbulence transition, and knowledge on numerical simulations Experienced in conducting research in boundary layer transition Experienced in DNS codes Possess a good track record for publication Possess good working knowledge of programming languages (C/C++, Fortran, MPI) Ability to work independently and as part of a team Self-driven and motivated

RoleResponsibility: The goal of the Yale-NUS Postdoctoral Fellowship is to attract talented young scholars, and provide a potential avenue for tenure track positions at Yale-NUS College. Normally, the College will appoint Postdoctoral Fellows for up to 3-year terms, with an initial 1-year term and a possible 2-year extension. Individuals who successfully complete a three-year fellowship with distinction may be considered for subsequent tenure or educator track positions following the term of their fellowships, provided the College has tenure-track or educator- track vacancies in the Division of Social Sciences Appointment & Salary: Â  Normally, individuals are appointed initially for a 1-year period with the possibility of a 2-year extension, and serve for a maximum of 3 years. Postdoctoral Fellows should be prepared to start the position in time for the 2018-2019 academic year (1stÂ July 2018).Â Â Annual salary is $72,000 (Singaporean dollars) with standard benefits. A modest research stipend for attending conferences or professional meetings, membership dues and subscriptions may also be provided. Postdoctoral appointees will be paired with a Yale-NUS faculty mentor, are expected to conduct high quality research within their particular field of expertise, and will teach one course per semester, with approximately half of the teaching within the Common Curriculum ( https://www.yale-nus.edu.sg/curriculum/common-curriculum/ ). Application Process: Review of application begins onÂ 20Â April 2018 and continues until the position is filled. For full consideration, submit the following materials viaÂ  https://academicjobsonline.org/ajo/YaleNUS :  Cover letter  CV   Statement on research interests and intended area of research   Short description of teaching experience to date and any teaching evaluations, if available   A curriculum contribution statement that briefly discusses the applicability of the candidateâ€™s teaching and scholarship to the Yale-NUS Common Curriculum   Three (3) letters of reference to be submitted by the reference writers via the application portal   For questions concerning administrative aspects of the application, please contact Divisional Manager, Social Sciences, Ms Renee Lau, at:Â  Enquiry_SocialSciencesDiv@yale-nus.edu.sg . The College values diversity and is committed to equality of opportunity. For more information about Yale-NUS College, please visit our website at:Â  http://www.yale-nus.edu.sg/ . Candidates should understand that by sharing information with Yale-NUS College, they authorise Yale-NUS College to use their personal data for the purposes of this application. Candidates may also understand that Yale-NUS College will not use their data for any purposes beyond those relevant to the application process, and that their data remains secure and confidential.
Requirements: Eligibility & Qualifications:Â   All nationalities  PhD completed no more than 2 years prior to the date of application   Academic potential, ability to bring diverse ideas to Yale-NUS, and a willingness to interact with a broad range of colleagues and students will be major selection criteria.   Expertise in one or more of the seven majors/disciplines within the Division of Social Sciences: Anthropology, Economics, Environmental Studies, Global Affairs, Philosophy, Politics and Economics, Psychology, and Urban Studies.

JobTitle: ED  /  SVP, Public Cloud Lead, IT Shared Services, Technology and Operations (180001C4)
RoleResponsibility: Job PurposeÂ  DBS is a leading regional bank, embracing innovation and digital technologies with a vision of Making Banking Joyful for our employees and our customers. We are underway with a Technology Transformation strategy, known as â€˜Gandalfâ€™, with clear vision to â€˜Design for Modern Systemsâ€™ and â€˜Automate Everythingâ€™, including to fully embrace both private and public cloud.Â  In 2018 we intend to accelerate our Public Cloud journey, already in place for a number of applications in production, to adopt AWS natively, with confidential data, and at scale.Â  A team has been created and is striving to deploy applications in Q2 with confidential data and native services, and our target is to progressively enable more workloads with a scalable, automated, self service approach. This Public Cloud Lead role is the person to lead the team to fully adopt public cloud, with a view of enabling self service, autonomous adoption with sophisticated detective controls.Â  Key AccountabilitiesÂ  Manage a small multi-functional team (some direct reports, some indirect, at least initially) to facilitate Public Cloud adoption across the organization for all workloads. Partner with and assist all Technology teams. Define the relevant framework for cloud adoption, with clarity around risk management, as well as preventive and detective measures to maximise self service autonomy. Clarity around decisions in all aspects of the framework Clear roadmap to facilitate public cloud for specific workload groups, with metrics around benefits, and increasingly sophisticated detective controls to maximise developer autonomy. Buy in, collaboration, and large scale adoption, from all Technology and Business teams Ongoing measurement of progress across all areas with a persistent focus to implement a clear vision of excellence in Public CloudÂ   ResponsibilitiesÂ   Manage a small cross functional team Define and implement the public cloud adoption framework with increasing maturity levels Create a Joyful developer environment, maximizing autonomy while minimizing risk Identify workload categories which have incremental benefit from public cloud and drive for maximum adoption Measure progress and benefits, and prioritise the continuing roadmap by optimizing effort relative to benefit
Requirements: At least 10-15 years of work experience, including at least 5 years of managementÂ  Public cloud implementation for an organization to a level of maturity Deep technical developer capability, with comprehensive experience of public cloud Deep understanding of and passion for the innovation and technology Certifications in Public Cloud â€“ preferably AWS Excellent relationship and stakeholder management skills Strong influencing skills; strategic thinker; hands-on and delivery focused Strong working knowledge and experience in AWS cloud services- e.g. EC2, ECS, Lambda, Kinesis, TensorFlow, S3, SQS etc..Â  Expert in tools such as Git, Jenkins, Junit, etc. and technologies such as Java, Ruby, Python, Scala, AngularJS, Swift and Node JS Experience in API and web engineering experience, including demonstrated experience in Java, Web services/ API, MariaDB, DB2 applications Understanding & experience in NoSQL DBs like MongoDB, Cassandra, Hadoop and demonstrates a deep understanding of a big data ecosystem. Must be able to understand and work on the various development languages and platforms â€“ Java/J2EE, WebSphere, Â SQL, Oracle, RBMS Strong working knowledge in UNIX/Linux/Windows and Oracle/SQL Server (SQL Querying, SP, triggers, views & other DBO.) Experience creating automation tools via scripting in both Linux as well as Windows environment.

RoleResponsibility: About the Institute for Infocomm Research (IÂ_R) The Institute for Infocomm Research (IÂ_R) is a member of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) family and is Singaporeâ€™s largest ICT research institute. Our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. For more information about I2R, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg We are looking for strong candidates in the field of ASIC/FPGA, Artificial Intelligence and deep learning, with an interest in working on design deep learning specific hardware chip and also applying it to practical problems such as car detention in autonomous vehicle. The position, based within the Program in Artificial Intelligence at I2R, entails working closely with a highly interdisciplinary team of researchers with training from leading universities at MIT, Stanford and CMU. Listed below are problems of interest in the Deep Leaming 2.0 hardware project: System Architecture Design for Deep Learning: Design an overall system, including an interface with the outside world (eg., HD video camera), a compiler framework, and an optimized computing architecture memory access bandwidth. RTL Design for Deep Learning:Â  Develop and debug RTL for specific deep learning algorithms including faster R-CNN with very deep ResNet as backbone, LSTM and 3D-CNN etc. Silicon/FPGA Design for Deep Learning: Silicon interface design and prototyping, Integrate the existing NN RTL into the Quartus toolchain and environment. Parameterize and adapt the NN to fit into FPGA. Add an RTL wrapper with the host-bridge and related buffing/flow-control. Develop front-end preprocessing on the ARM cores in the HPS part of the FPGA. Provide related CI/build tooling via GIT and validation automation. Add a DRAM/HBM memory interface to test at scale.Â Â  Deep Learning on Embedded Devices: Towards 100X smaller models Current deep learning models have10 s of millions of neurons, making it infeasible for deployment on mobile and embedded hardware. The aim is to achieve models that are I00x smaller, with little loss in performance. This capability will also be critical for emerging neuromorphic platforms, where the number of spiking neurons is orders of magnitude smaller than in current state-of-the-art deep learning models. Extreme Deep Learning: Training lB neural networks efficiently The high model capacity of deep networks is why increasingÂ  amounts of data and modelÂ  size improves performance. However, there are substantial challenges in hardware and algorithms challenges in training very large models efficiently. The aim is to address these challenges to achieve more efficient training. Â
Requirements: Minimum BachelorÂ in Computer Science, Statistics, or Data Science intensive fields, with expertise in one or more of the following areas: 	 Â Large-scale machine learning Â Deep learning, supervised or unsupervised Â Applying state-of-art machine learning techniques to practical problems in different domains   Experience in corporate or application orientated environments is a plus. Ability to work independently, as well as in teams highly desired.Â Â  Good communication skills for proposals, reports, and publications. Proficiency in spoken and written English. Strong programming abilities (e.g. Perl, Bash, C/C++, Java, Python, R, MATLAB) Â Computer vision and deep learning skills desirable  The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified

A key outcome of the project will be the establishment and ongoing support of an independent database of data breach incidents, vulnerability and economic loss data, with a focus on the Asia-Pacific region.Â  The project has a large research component requiring a strong link with academia that is achieved at an international level through collaborations with universities world-wide The post-doctoral positions are expected to have 2-year duration, starting in Spring or Fall of 2018. The candidate is expected to contribute to the ongoing research efforts in cyber risk management and financing of catastrophe risks, and to publish academic papers in high-quality actuarial science, risk management and insurance, business and finance journals. The successful candidate will work in a multidisciplinary environment with cyber risk modelers, cyber insurance underwriters and information security experts. He/she will contribute to the cyber risk management framework under development by the project team. This position will report to the Director of IRFRC.
Requirements: Qualified candidates must have a completedÂ PhD by the time of appointment in Actuarial Science, Risk Management and Insurance, Finance, Economics, or related discipline.Â   We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

JobTitle: Programmer & Developer for an Awesome Craft Beer Distributor
RoleResponsibility: About us The Drinkery is a leading craft beer distributor and retailer based in Singapore with a vision to be the drinks provider of choice for both brand owners and consumers. Everybody knows beer is expensive in Singapore, hence our mission is to deliver the best quality craft beers at the most affordable prices to Singaporean consumers. To do so, we want to leverage the use of technology and automation to get beer from producers to consumers in the most efficient way possible. Â  Our core values and culture  We solve problems and create values for our customers, and we work extremely hard to be the best at what we do. Â  Who are we looking for A creative problem solver with a strong programming skillset who can use technology to simplify, optimise and automate process workflow of every aspects of our business. Efficiency is the name of the game. Basically, when you see inefficiencies, you fix it. You are not expected to build anything from scratch, but you should be highly adept in selecting, using and implementing available automation apps or platforms and connecting them together to build a holistic solution that works. This includes building an inventory management system (IMS) that connects with accounting, marketing, sales, HR and logistics automation apps. And most importantly, you need to design it so user-friendly that your colleagues would want to use it. We want to bring the B2C e-commerce experience to our B2B customers, so you will build a customer-facing order management system (OMS) that connects to our back-end systems to provide our customers with the most seamless purchasing and payment experience in the industry. This system will be so easy-to-use that our customers will be queuing up to buy beer from us because itâ€™s so easy. We want to build a beautiful and efficient e-commerce website that sells, so youâ€™ll work together with our very talented designer and leverage our existing Shopify platform to build an awesome online store to serve our B2C customers their daily beer needs. We love data and swear by it to make decisions. You will be the go-to person who can collect, manage, extract and manipulate data from various apps that we use and present it to the team in a format that we, normal humans would understand. Sometimes weâ€™ll find bugs that frustrates us, non-techie people, to the point that we want to pull our hair out. You will be the saviour who comes in and quickly fix things and get things back to normal. All in all, you are the technology expert in the company and you are in charge of anything and everything programming and technical-related to get us to be the most efficient operator in the drinks distribution business.

Be able to design solutions that fit user needs and gain user acceptance. Be a strong hands-on executor who can initiate and complete project successfully. Possess a creative mind with an out-of-the-box strategic thinking process. Be a strong communicator who can convey complex ideas with clarity. Be a self-starter who doesnâ€™t need to be told what to do. Have a strong desire to win and stand out from competition. Not be afraid to roll up your sleeves, take the bull by the horns and get your hands dirty. Get things done fast, effectively and efficiently to deliver results.  Â  If you love beer and has what it takes to get the job done, this may well be your dream job, so please send your CV together with (1) a convincing cover letter, (2) tell us what is your vision of aÂ highly efficient beer distributor, how would you build the systems to make us more efficient and an outline of how you would execute your mandates , (3) a recent photo of yourself to roland@thedrinkery.com.sg. Perform other duties as assigned by the Reporting Officer or designated representative.

To support the research, investigate and execute smart manufacturing factor

RoleResponsibility: The Metro Fibre Deployment Engineer (DE) is responsible for managing some of the most technical, cost efficient, and fast paced communication construction project schedules achievable. Amazon Metro Fibre Deployment Engineers are constantly challenged to drive continuous improvement and deliver the highest quality, most technically efficient connectivity solutions in the world.  As a Metro Fibre DE you will be a part of highly creative, efficient team tasked with tackling the most fascinating and challenging problems in fibre construction. Amazon Metro Fibre DE's are always at the forefront of the construction industry in terms of innovation, and maintain a focus to deliver the most innovative products to our customers.  Our networks are industry leading in terms of capacity and cost effectiveness. The Metro Fibre DE is ultimately responsible for the day to day construction oversight and management of the contractors. The DE will also be utilized as a leader in their specific discipline (construction management, fibre splicing, OSP Design, ISP Construction or system installation/commissioning) and be responsible as a team member for delivering construction of some of the most complex networks in the world.  Project management and oversight of construction related activities for new builds or general capital projects. This will include the ownership of the project scope, timeline, and budget. Ensure the construction standards are followed. Perform quality audits and ensure issues are remediated before the vendors are released from the project. Understand the metro fibre market segments, customer base, and industry verticals. Interface with key internal stakeholders (e.g. Networking, Data Center Engineering, PMs, Data Center Management, security, etc ) to obtain their requirements and drive vendors to adhere to these key elements. Interface with data center providers to drive equipment and circuit installations. Understand the technical requirements of our engineering teams and ensure the completed project meets these requirements. Understand fibre deployment types and insure that diversity requirements that are required are met. Deep understanding of the fibre construction process. Prepare and give status reviews to the management team regarding progress and roadblocks on the project. Develop long-term strategic partnerships in support of our key markets. Handle ad-hoc incoming inquiries and problems to ensure the construction programs continue on schedule Creation of project scope and equipment requirements, assist with request for proposals, and capital requests. Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time. Ability to work across multiple time zones Willing to travel 25-50% of the time.
Requirements: BASIC QUALIFICATIONS  The right person will be highly technical and analytical, possess 5-7 years of network construction management and/or program/product management experience in an telecom environment. Understand the fibre business and have worked on multiple telecom construction programs. Excellent attention to detail is essential Ability to prioritize multiple competing demands to deliver for the customers in a specific time window. Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS  Having strong contacts in fibre, transport and infrastructure markets. Good technical understanding of transport technologies (Fibre, DWDM, etc.) Has led multiple large network construction programs.. Ability to speak multiple languages International work experience.

RoleResponsibility: Amazon is looking for a results-oriented individual to join the AWS Infrastructure Energy Team (IET). In this role, you will engage with electric utilities to manage the interconnection of Amazonâ€™s Asia Pacific data centers to the grid. This role will collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to grow AWSâ€™s diverse, and low-cost energy supply. The candidate must be able to manage projects and help evaluate potential savings opportunities in the energy space. The candidate will identify and develop energy projects, programs, and initiatives and execute on these. The candidate will develop a cost effective energy strategy for the APAC region, manage utility interactions, and procure power. By establishing and growing business and technical relationships, and managing the day-to-day interactions with these partners, you will be responsible for driving out cost and meeting energy team objectives to support AWSâ€™s global infrastructure expansion. Function Specific Work Activities:  Support the development and execution of a comprehensive energy and utilities strategy for AWS APAC data centers Manage the interconnection of AWS APAC data centers to the electric grid by working with utilities and local operations teams across the globe Expand and develop AWS renewable energy strategy in APAC region. Manage capital budgets for electrical infrastructure improvements Identify and develop cost savings projects and initiatives related to energy infrastructure. Collaborate with the Infrastructure Energy Team on the implementation and management of energy and projects in a timely and accurate fashion.

Experience developing or constructing substations or other energy infrastructure Experience working with public utility commissions and other energy regulators International business experience Experience with IT infrastructure, data centers and cloud services

RoleResponsibility: The Laboratory of Neural Stem Cells studies neural stem cell homeostasis and brain development. The candidate will be required to perform a variety of functions related to research under the supervision of the Principal Investigator or his/her designate: -  Establish work procedures; select sources of information and specific data; set up interviews with appropriate authorities or subjects and prepare correspondence to locate the specific data required. Accurate monitoring, documenting and reporting of experimental results and research findings. Evaluate and interpret collected data and prepare oral presentations or written reports/ scientific manuscripts/literature for publication and analyses setting forth progress, adverse trends and appropriate recommendations or conclusions. Contribute to some project management, provision of guidance to undergraduate/medical students. Perform other related duties incidental to the work described herein.

RoleResponsibility: This role belongs to the Marketing/Sales Effectiveness Practice which is to identify the optimal path to improve effectiveness of clients' marketing (or sales) strategy/activities via advanced analytical solutions.   The mission of this role is to help our clients identify their business opportunities or solve their business issues, by proposing optimal analytical solutions and delivering the analysis with actionable business insights, based on deep understanding of client needs and robust analytical expertise across varied Nielsen solutions. Once a project is commissioned, the individual in this role will collaborate with internal modeling hub on most solutions, translating client needs into detailed analytical requirements for the modeling hub, and drawing/reporting actionable business insights out of the modeling/analytics outcome to meet clients' business needs. Through this, this role will build client satisfactions, leading to sustainable revenue for Nielsen.   To achieve this mission, the individual will be responsible for:   Accountable for leading analysis projects on assigned Marketing/Sales Effectiveness solutions and ensure the assigned study deliverables meet client needs with actionable insights in a timely manner, as well as company's quality standards, under a supervision of a manager.   Analytical mastery of assigned Marketing (or Sales) Effectiveness solutions, and technical mastery by collaborating with internal solution experts/modeling hub. Translate client needs into study design and detailed analytical requirements, for flawless briefing to the modeling hub. Gather necessary data for analysis from clients or other internal departments in Nielsen, and review quality of the data, to feed the modeling hub. Guide the modeling hub to ensure timely modeling execution following Nielsen quality standards. Interpret modeling outcomes from the hub with actionable business insights to fully meet client needs and company's quality standards. Assist in the analysis and report development for clients, including charting. Assist in answering inquiries from clients on the analysis of outcomes. Support senior members of the team in proposal development, including detailed solution specs finalization, collaborating with internal solution experts, and preparation for proposal presentations. Recommend improvements in work processes within area of responsibility.
Requirements: BA/BS in numerate discipline required. Robust logical/analytical thinking. Strong Problem-solving capability, sometimes through out-of-box thinking. Excellent communication skills, can articulate concepts simply and concisely to the point. Strong mindset on accountability, results oriented; one who takes initiatives & follow-through. Robust statistical knowledge. Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills. Able to convert ideas into powerful visualizations & charts.

RoleResponsibility: About the Institute of High Performance ComputingÂ (IHPC) A*STARâ€™s Institute of High Performance Computing (IHPC) was established in April 1998 to provide leadership in high performance computing as a strategic resource for scientific inquiry and industry development. It seeks to power discoveries through advanced methodologies, techniques and new tools in modelling, simulation and visualisation. Its core research areas are in the realm of complex-coupled systems, mechanics and fluid dynamics, large-scale systems, digital modelling, adaptive and collaborative computing, data mining and analysis, computational electronics and electromagnetics, computational materials science and chemistry.Â  For more information about IHPC, please visit www.ihpc.a-star.edu.sgÂ  Job Description Institute of High Performance Computing (IHPC) is looking for candidates with the talent and passion to pursue first class research in modelling and simulation. You will be expected to conduct innovative research, design and develop cutting edge models and algorithms for analysing multi-process/source and heterogeneous data from advanced manufacturing science and engineering domains. You will also be expected to work closely with the researchers from IHPC as well as other A*STAR institutes to drive the development of prognostics and optimization modelling capabilities for predictive maintenance. The successful candidates will have the opportunities to collaborate with researchers and practitioners from other A*STAR institutes, as well as industry partners to translate the developed solutions for tackling real world modelling and simulation problems confronted today and in near future.
Requirements: PhD degree in Computer Science/Engineering or other related fields. Experience in analyzing data of different variety would be an advantage. Programming experience in Python, Matlab, R, C++, Java, etc. Able to work in a collaborative environment. Able to communicate well with colleagues and collaborators Experience in database management and web-based development is a plus Fast learner with abilit Â to multi-task 1 to 3 years of work experience  To apply, you should demonstrate in your CV the following essential skills:  Ability to develop computational models Ability to perform analysis in Python.

RoleResponsibility: AWS Infrastructure Planning and Sourcing (IPS) is searching for a bright and ambitious individual to join our team as a Supply Chain Manager (SCM). The role will be responsible financial controller ship including execution of tasks associated with securing approval for spend (new PO and tracking spend against Blanket POs), work with owners of capital budgets to assist in securing Capital Asset Requests. The role audits purchases, purchase requisition (PR) / purchase order (PO) generation and management, vendor sourcing and competitive bidding and is a member of Infrastructure Planning and Sourcing (IPS) team.  This position will partner with the IScAP leadership team in the development of capital and operational budget planning, including the submittal and management of contract requests from our technical and operational teams. Additionally, this role will work with these teams in the vetting and engagement of both new and existing vendors and will be point of contact for PR submission and PO management. The SCM will have ownership over daily maintenance and follow-up on new and open contract and/or PR tickets to ensure that purchasing and contract requests are tracking to completion. The SCM will assist in vetting and creating scopes of work, which are a key component of work orders. The SCM will provide procurement coverage for all aspects of regional operations; ranging from preventative maintenance and emergency response PRâ€™s to planning/purchasing of equipment spares to general office supplies. The SCM must have to ability to clearly communicate and explain complex demand/supply forecasts (inputs, outputs, rationale, gaps) and recommendations to senior management. The SCM will need to understand the technical requirements of our partners and work closely with the internal development teams to guide the direction of procurement activities. The SCM will also monitor inventory levels to ensure that proper stock levels are maintained to support build and repair activities. They will ensure appropriate inventory levels are maintained and make inventory movement/transfer decisions for various Data centers. They will also evaluate potential restocking or purchasing requirements with the Data Center Operations Manager to ensure our operational strategies are met. The scope includes to have all shipments in compliance with local country regulations, ensure right classification and description for new items and interface with internal Import/Export teams. The SCM should be aware of and comply with Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) and along with local country laws/regulations at all times while discharging his/her duties. This role will have a strong focus on continuous improvement, developing/tracking key performance indicators and the successful candidate will have a proven track record developing models, tools and processes to increase the overall supply chain effectiveness, reliability, responsiveness and costs efficiency, achieved through process improvements and streamlining procedures/workflows.  The ideal candidate will have experience working in a high volume, warehouse or distribution environment, as well as experience and knowledge of reverse logistics processes. Candidates must have advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel be comfortable working with Microsoft Office products.  The ideal candidate is a self-starter, possesses strong verbal and written communication skills, and has strong attention to detail. You must be able to work independently and generate high-quality work products in an ambiguous environment. You must have a professional demeanor and be able to communicate appropriately with people at every level, from technicians to upper management. Operating in a and sometimes ambiguous environment you will be required to work autonomously taking full control and responsibility for achieving business objectives. This role provides a real opportunity to develop original ideas, approaches, and solutions in a competitive and ever changing business climate.
Requirements: BASIC QUALIFICATIONS  Bachelorâ€™s degree, preferably in procurement supply chain from a reputed University. 4 to 7 years in procurement / supply chain with demonstrated knowledge of Inventory Planning management, end to end contract administration and Vendor management from sourcing to performance. Experience in change management and process improvement. Ability to translate large amounts of data into useful information and draw conclusions. Maintain key operational metrics that measure supply chain performance driving continuous improvement. Ability to work with technical and non-technical business owners to overcome obstacles and deliver results. 5+ yearsâ€™ experience with Microsoft office (PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Outlook, Access) Exceptional analytics, judgment, and communication skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences. Ability to meet tight deadlines and prioritize workloads.  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS  Experience in infrastructure operations would be an advantage, but is not essential. Experience in mechanical and electrical facility management would be an advantage, but is not essential. Experience implementing continuous improvement methodologies and programs such as Lean, Six Sigma, DMAIC and Change Management. Experience in project management and a strong track record of project delivery for large, cross-functional projects would be an advantage.

JobTitle: GIS - Postdoctoral Fellow (Algorithms for Long Read Transcript Quantification)
RoleResponsibility: Â  Long read sequencing has the promise to overcome some of the key limitations of short read sequencing technologies. Amongst others, long read sequencing allows the quantification of full length transcripts and enables direct RNA sequencing without amplification. As the technology is still in an early phase, there are only few algorithms available to study long read transcriptomics data. The group of Jonathan GÃ¶ke is searching for a postdoctoral fellow to develop algorithms for high throughput, long read transcriptomics data, and to lead a project on transcriptional diversity in cancer.

RoleResponsibility: The Department of Civil & Environmental Engineering at NUS invites applications for 1 postdoctoral research position to work on this project. The main focus of this research project is to develop Bayesian learning methods to tackle "MUSIC" geotechnical data. The practical impact is that engineers can estimate design properties from the full suite of geotechnical tests routinely conducted in practice, thus deriving full value for the investment. In short, the characteristics of geotechnical data, which can vary in space and time, can be succinctly described as MUSIC â€“ Multivariate, Uncertain and unique, Sparse, and InComplete.
Requirements: PhD in Civil Engineering or equivalent Deep knowledge of Bayesian methods Proven track record in writing computer codes Good analytical ability and conceptual thinking

Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies. Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

RoleResponsibility: The Merchandise Space Planner for Spirit/Wines/Tobacco (SWT) will be responsible for developing and maintaining detailed planograms by store location based on passenger profile by location, SWT strategy and productivity/profitability targets.Â  The Space Planner will partner with the Global & Regional Merchandizing teams, Planning, Store Operations, Replenishment & Allocations and Visual Merchandizing to drive results through effective planograms and merchandize presentation. Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities The role and responsibilities of this truly cross-functional position will be focused on, but not limited to:  Create, execute and update planograms across Spirits, Wine and Tobacco category in close collaboration with Merchandizing team supporting all stores in the Singapore region Conduct sku/space productivity/profitability reviews and analysis, quickly identifying trends in business and adjust space needs based on sell through/OOS Analyze sales, trends and passengerâ€™s data to develop, recommend and execute category specific space merchandising opportunities to maximize floor productivity Work closely with the merchants/planners on range review, sku optimization and rationalization.Â Â  Work closely with operations to maximize density on the floor to drive sales, UPT Develop merchandising standards to ensure all planograms and associated materials, including Visual Merchandizing, are commercially focused, relevant for customers and effective for stores Improve and fine-tune existing processes so to come to a Standard Operational Procedure (SOP) that will support successful implementation of planograms Evolve the merchandising approach over time in line with changing shopper and business needs using trial activity where necessary to verify the approach. Â
